description.narrative: KS4P will address the challenges described above by improving skills development systems, policies, services and enabling environments for young people, especially from the identified marginalised groups, in industries key to Kenya’s national economic growth. An important focus of the programme will be capacity building of key national skills development and training stakeholders and their linking with industries, while ensuring gender responsive and disability inclusive employment. Embedding capacity building at institutional level and supporting systemic change, the programme will ensure a broad sustainable impact beyond its duration and the contexts and actors targeted. Through technical assistance to advance industry relevant curricula, continuous professional development for TVET teachers and trainers and improvement of the accessibility and adaptability of existing services, the programme will address the needs of marginalised groups as described above.
